sen.j: 西近江路（にしおうみじ）は、近江国（滋賀県）から越前国へ通じる街道で、古代・中世の北陸道。
sen.e: Nishioumi-ji Road is a highway that stretches from Oumi Province (Shiga Prefecture) to Echizen Province, and was the road connecting Hokuriku area in the ancient and middle ages.
Nishioumi-ji Road is a highway that stretches from Oumi Province (Shiga Prefecture) to Echizen Province, and was the road connecting Hokuriku area in the ancient and middle ages.
Nishioumi-ji Road is a highway that stretches from Oumi Province (Shiga Prefecture) to Echizen Province, and was the road connecting Hokuriku area in the ancient and middle ages.

sen.j: 北国海道、北国脇往還、北国往還、北国脇道とも。
sen.e: It was also called Hokkoku Kai-do Road, Hokkokuwaki Oukan, Hokkoku Oukan or Hokkoku Waki-do Road.
It was also called Hokkoku Kai-do Road, Hokkokuwaki Oukan, Hokkoku Oukan or Hokkoku Waki-do Road.
It was also called Hokkoku Kai-do Road, Hokkokuwaki Oukan, Hokkoku Oukan or Hokkoku Waki-do Road.

sen.j: 1887年（明治20年）に西近江路として県道となりこの名称が定着した。
sen.e: In 1887, it became a prefectural road and the name of Nishioumi-ji Road was established.
In 1887, it became a prefectural road and the name of Nishioumi-ji Road was established.
In 1887, it became a prefectural road and the name of Nishioumi-ji Road was established.

sen.j: 古来より都と北陸を結ぶ道として人の往来が多いだけでなく、壬申の乱、藤原仲麻呂の乱、源平合戦、織田信長の朝倉攻めなどでは大軍が移動している。
sen.e: Since the ancient times, the route had heavy traffic, connecting the ancient capital and Hokuriku area, and large armies moved along the road during the Jinshin-no-ran Uprising, Nakamaro FUJIWARA Uprising, Genpei Conflicts and the attack on ASAKURA by Nobunaga ODA.

Since the ancient times, the route had heavy traffic, connecting the ancient capital and Hokuriku area, and large armies moved along the road during the Jinshin Uprising, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's Uprising, Genpei War and the attack on Asakura by Nobunaga ODA.
sen.cmt: Jinshin Uprisingに訂正しました。FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's Uprisingに訂正しました。Genpei Warに訂正しました。Asakuraに訂正しました。
sen.e: Since the ancient times, the route had heavy traffic, connecting the ancient capital and Hokuriku area, and large armies moved along the road during the Jinshin Uprising, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's Uprising, Genpei War and the attack on Asakura by Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: また、平安時代の遣渤海使もこの道を通るなど、交流の道でもあった。
sen.e: This was also a route for international exchanges, used, for example, by Kenbokkaishi (emmisaries sent to Bokkai) during the Heian era.
This was also a route for international exchanges, used, for example, by Kenbokkaishi (emissaries sent to Bo-Hai) during the Heian era.
sen.cmt: emissariesスペル訂正しました。渤海→Bo-Haiに訂正しました。
sen.e: This was also a route for international exchanges, used, for example, by Kenbokkaishi (emissaries sent to Bo-Hai) during the Heian era.

sen.j: （古代）
sen.e: (Ancient times)
(Ancient times)
(Ancient times)

sen.j: 小関越え → 穴多（太）駅（大津市穴太） → 和邇駅（大津市和邇中浜） → 三尾駅（高島市安曇川町三尾） → 鞆結駅（高島市マキノ町小荒路・海津・浦・石庭） → 愛発関（敦賀市疋田か） →
sen.e: going over the Ozeki Pass -->Anata Station (Otsu, Anata City) --> Wani Station (Wani Nakahama, Ootsu City) -->Mio Station (Mio, Azumikawamachi, Takashima City) -->Tomoyui-no-eki Station (Koaraji, Kaizu, Ura and Sekitei of Makino-cho, Takashima City) --> Arachinoseki (Hikita, Tsuruga City)
sen.cmt: 最後の「か」は地名の一部ではないと判断。
sen.e: Going over the Ozeki Pass - Anata Station (Otsu, Anata City) - Wani Station (Wani Nakahama, Otsu City) - Mio Station (Mio, Azumikawa-machi, Takashima City) - Tomoyui-no-eki Station (Koaraji, Kaizu, Ura and Sekitei of Makino-cho, Takashima City) - Arachi no seki (Hikita, Tsuruga City)
sen.cmt: Going 大文字にしました。ハイフンに訂正、スペース補足しました。Otsuに訂正しました。ハイフン補足しました。スペース補足しました。
sen.e: Going over the Ozeki Pass - Anata Station (Otsu, Anata City) - Wani Station (Wani Nakahama, Otsu City) - Mio Station (Mio, Azumikawa-machi, Takashima City) - Tomoyui-no-eki Station (Koaraji, Kaizu, Ura and Sekitei of Makino-cho, Takashima City) - Arachi no seki (Hikita, Tsuruga City)

sen.j: （近世）
sen.e: (Modern times)
(Modern times)

sen.j: 大津宿・札の辻（大津市札の辻） → 衣川宿（大津市衣川） → 和邇宿（大津市和邇中） → 木戸宿（大津市木戸） → 北小松宿（大津市北小松） → 河原市宿（高島市新旭町新庄） → 今津宿（高島市今津町今津） → 海津宿（高島市マキノ町海津） → 敦賀宿（敦賀市元町）
sen.e: Ootsu-juku/Fudanotsuji (Fudanotsuji, Ootsu City) --> Koromogawa-juku(Koromogawa, Ootsu City) --> Wani -juku(Waninaka, Ootsu City) -> Kido-juku (Kido, Ootsu City) -->Kita Komatsu-juku (Kita Komatsu, Ootsu City) -->Kawarashi-juku (Shinjo, Shin Asahi-cho, Takashima City) --> Imazu-juku (Imazu, Imazu-cho, Takashima City) --> Kaizu-juku, (Kaizu, Makino-cho, Takashima City) -->Tsuruga-juku (Motomachi, Tsuruga City)

Otsu-juku/Fudanotsuji (Fudanotsuji, Otsu City) - Koromogawa-juku (Koromogawa, Otsu City) - Wani-juku (Waninaka, Otsu City) - Kido-juku (Kido, Otsu City) - Kita Komatsu-juku (Kita Komatsu, Otsu City) - Kawarashi-juku (Shinjo, Shin Asahi-cho, Takashima City) - Imazu-juku (Imazu, Imazu-cho, Takashima City) - Kaizu-juku (Kaizu, Makino-cho, Takashima City) - Tsuruga-juku (Moto-machi, Tsuruga City)
sen.cmt: ハイフンに訂正、スペース補足しました。Otsuに訂正しました。スペース補足しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。不要なコンマを削除しました。ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: Otsu-juku/Fudanotsuji (Fudanotsuji, Otsu City) - Koromogawa-juku (Koromogawa, Otsu City) - Wani-juku (Waninaka, Otsu City) - Kido-juku (Kido, Otsu City) - Kita Komatsu-juku (Kita Komatsu, Otsu City) - Kawarashi-juku (Shinjo, Shin Asahi-cho, Takashima City) - Imazu-juku (Imazu, Imazu-cho, Takashima City) - Kaizu-juku (Kaizu, Makino-cho, Takashima City) - Tsuruga-juku (Moto-machi, Tsuruga City)

sen.j: （国宝）金堂・新羅善神堂・光浄院客殿・勧学院客殿・絹本著色不動明王像（黄不動）・新羅明神坐像・円珍坐像（御骨大師）・智証大師坐像（中尊大師）・五部心観・智証大師関係文書典籍
sen.e: National treasures at Onjo-ji Temple: Kondo, Shinrazenshindo, Kojo-in Temple Kyakuden (visitors' quarters), Kangakuin Kyakuden, Kenponchoshoku Fudoo Statue (Ou Fudo), Shinra Myojin Zazo, Enchin Zazo (Okotsudaishi), Chisho Daishi Zazo (Chuson Daiji), Gobushinkan, Chisho Daishi related materials
sen.cmt: 国宝は園城寺にあるということがわからないので、at Onjo-ji Templeと入れました。
sen.e: National treasures at Onjo-ji Temple: Kondo, Shinrazenshindo, Kojo-in Temple Kyakuden (visitors' quarters), Kangakuin Kyakuden, Kenponchoshoku Fudoo Statue (Ou Fudo), Shinra Myojin Zazo, Enchin Zazo (Okotsudaishi), Chisho Daishi Zazo (Chuson Daiji), Gobushinkan, Chisho Daishi related materials
